metadata.subject: [patchmanagement] RE: Tesla patching update
metadata.email_text_original:
You don't often get email from philipelder@mpecsinc.ca. Learn why this is
important [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
Scary. 
Our 2016 RAM 1500 got two firmware updates to “try” and “fix” a bug in the
cruise control. The bug was the software ignoring any steering wheel control
button presses. It nearly got me the first time it reared its head while the
second I was semi-ready for it. 
The first firmware update failed to address the problem. It would crash the
entire system dash and all if I held the CANCEL button for a determined period
of time. 
The second firmware update stopped crashing the entire system and instead put
the cruise system into what can only be called an unresponsive loop. 
Another aspect to the bug is ignoring the on/off button when we want to turn it
on and use it. The only way to reset that is to stop, park the truck, and let it
sit for at least 10 minutes after opening and closing the door to kill the
residual power. 
I got to know the service desk really well with this truck (air ride suspension
& winter don’t mix). They were telling me all sorts of software horror stories.
It wasn’t pretty. 
Tesla is not the only one. 
Philip Elder MCTS 
Senior Technical Architect 
Microsoft High Availability MVP
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmvp.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2FPublicProfile%2F4024277&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C4de845bfea31430d98b008dc032c642c%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638388736402637974%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ir5YVWhWcbMRKh1WYVIEupjo%2BqGZv0BwkptlRX%2FATXg%3D&reserved=0]

PSA: We have confirmed that Tesla pulled all iterations of the holiday update
including 2023.44.30.1 through 2023.44.30.4. 
Vehicles that have received these updates will receive a new update within the
next week and includes many bug fixes for issues reported by vehicle owners. 
12/21/23, 5:27 PM
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fx.com%2Fteslascope%2Fstatus%2F1738008254188540164%3Fs%3D43%26t%3DKuONIw82G4a5IlI_mSrZrg&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C4de845bfea31430d98b008dc032c642c%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638388736402637974%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=uWRQaN7xOMMbcDYN9N5N558aHDTiSC14upggUUqDF5I%3D&reserved=0]
